intro: Jatropha tanjorensis, commonly known as the Tanjore croton, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of India. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its striking, colorful foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by capsule fruits containing toxic seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and as a decorative plant.
